name: How to calculate HP each level?
author: sataricon

posts.author: sataricon
posts.content:
As the title says some PW make your HP based on a dice roll and you have to try many times to gain the max HP/level.
But because i'm very new i want to ask how do you know what is the max HP for each level?

specially when you take RDD and you gain the feat "hit die increase" how to calculate this with bounce constitution?
Thank you in advance.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
This is how I do it. 

Maybe wait for others to confirm this is a good strategy or check my math, I was always taught to check and double check any math problems I completed!

I have not played a lot of RDDs, and you cannot redo your levels as an RDD on WoG: 

- check the hit die each level from the NWN wiki https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Red_dragon_disciple, it varies per level

- add constitution bonus (and +1 from toughness) to determine the expected max hit die roll (ie cons 12-> +1 cons bonus, with d6 and toughness = 8hp)

- if constitution bonus increase is achieved that level (ie Cons 13 to Cons 14) then add your extra cons bonus (ie +1 in this example) multiplied by your new character level (ie Bard 8 RDD 2 = 10) to your expected max hit die roll hp to determine how much HP you should maximally gain that level (in this example 8hp + 10 = 18hp)

- same with toughness. +1 multiplied by new level added to expected max hit die roll (in this example 8hp + 10 = 18hp)
